body:
This would need some high level design including
- a brief discussion of popular, well-known, actively maintained reverse proxies and a proposal for which to support, and
- an enumeration of the issues that prevent its use with MLflow, if any
- proposals for how to remove each of the barriers, with discussions of tradeoffs and impact (e.g. does this break existing URL structure for pages?)
FWIW, we are able to serve the UI from behind a reverse proxy by just stripping the leading "/" from all instances of "`/ajax-api/`" in the javascript.
This feature would be required to integrate MLFlow with JupyterHub

@elgalu I think the issue with leading "/" has already been solve in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/commit/1e39ef24160717a23dfb96ed1c0e92febca1afc3 . I have been running MLflow in a subdirectory behind nginx without any issues.
We've been using MLFlow behind a nginx reverse proxy a bit using https://github.com/soundsensing/mlflow-easyauth, and mostly working OK
It's unclear from the comments in this issue - is one able to run MLflow tracking server behind a reverse proxy and under a leading path e.g. http://my-server.com/mlflow?

> It's unclear from the comments in this issue - is one able to run MLflow tracking server behind a reverse proxy and under a leading path e.g. http://my-server.com/mlflow?

Hi @jhallard. Yes, this should work.

> > It's unclear from the comments in this issue - is one able to run MLflow tracking server behind a reverse proxy and under a leading path e.g. http://my-server.com/mlflow?
> 
> Hi @jhallard. Yes, this should work.

So if I'm running a reverse proxy with NGINX, proxy passing the location as `location /mlflow`, is it sufficient to be running the server with `--static-prefix /mlflow` or there are some other adjustments that need to be done? Ex. when setting the tracking uri etc.
A mini insight on this a bit detailed would be much appreciated. Especially since there are no real example on the matter or any resource/docs whatsoever.

For anyone who lands on this page and searching on how to get MLflow to fully work with a reverse proxy, https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/4484#issuecomment-919377871 this info by @akuma12 was super helpful.
